page.title: 09Much Marcle Church
page.content: Much Marcle Church dates from the 13th century and is built of local sandstone.It has a tower with gargoyles which is traditionally believed to have been built from stones taken from Mortimers Castle.The site of the castle is only 50 yards north of the church.There are two interesting features in the church.The first is the Kyrle Chapel which was built in the 13th century and houses the Kyrle tomb.The second feature is a rare wooden monumental effigy of a man in 14th century costume.Outside the church there is a saxon cross which was there before the church was built and is where the Saxon villagers worshiped.In the graveyard there is a huge yew tree with a hollow trunk which is 200yrs old.In the hollow there is a bench where you can sit.
